intro: Securinega abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to regions of East Africa. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short peduncles. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The plant is also known for its milky sap, which is a common feature among species in the Apocynaceae family.
